title: Bornivorous set
summary: In functional analysis, a subset of a real or complex vector space X {\displaystyle X} that has an associated vector bornology B {\displaystyle {\mathcal {B}}} is called bornivorous and a bornivore if it absorbs every element of B . {\displaystyle {\mathcal {B}}.} If X {\displaystyle X} is a topological vector space (TVS) then a subset S {\displaystyle S} of X {\displaystyle X} is bornivorous if it is bornivorous with respect to the von-Neumann bornology of X {\displaystyle X} .
